BR_text.BRsummary: Pipeline not starting on SciServer Compute
BR_text.BRdescription:
It appears that for some users (such as kmoore), running a pipeline on SciServer Compute hangs indefinitely. Looking at the server logs shows:
 <denchmark-code>2020-08-06T16:59:31.823Z - error: [gme:server:worker:simpleworker:pid_514591:WorkerFunctions:PluginManagerBase:plugin:ExecutePipeline] Could not execute "GetCifar10Data": Error: SciServer Files request failed: Error in job definition
 </denchmark-code>
 
 As this appears to be specific to this user, I suspect the error is happening on the SciServer side. However, this should be handled better by deepforge so we don't need to go to the server logs.

comments_0.comment_text: The issue seems to be that the sciserver docker image DeepForge is accessible to some users while not for other users. So, I would recharacterize this issue not to be a code related bug in deepforge but rather an issue with sciserver's docker image for deepforge access to every account.

comments_1.comment_text:
Thanks, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/umesh-timalsina>@umesh-timalsina</denchmark-link>
  for finding the source of the issue. I am going to leave this issue since the error is not handled properly in deepforge. (The pipeline should show the error when an error occurs during job creation.)
